intro: Heracleum wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan cow parsnip, is a tall, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant can grow up to 2 meters in height, with large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, forming dense clusters at the top of the plant, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as schizocarps. Heracleum wallichii is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
